chargeHist.descr: Physical Abuse of an Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lue Xiong

defendant.name: Xiong, Lue
defendant.address: 814 N Hastings Way, Eau Claire, WI 54701

records.addlTxt: Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Competency hearing on December 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:13 PM case called. Attorney Loralee Clark in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Lue Xiong in court, in custody with Attorney Roger M Hillestad. Attorney Hillestad requests that the defendant be evaluated for competency and notes reasoning. Defendant requests that he be read the charges. Court advises the defendant of the charges in this case. 

Court orders that a competency evaluation be completed and finds probable cause for the charges base on the complaint.

Speedy Trial demand is tolled based on pending issue of competency. 

Competency hearing set for 12/06/2022 at 10:00 AM (45 minutes) Examiner is allowed to appear via Zoom.
Status conference on October 27, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Dated 10/20/2022, Letter from Attorney Roger Hillestad to Court raising issue of competency.
Defendant's Demand for Speedy Trial
State's Motion in Limine

1:30PM Defendant Lue Xiong in court, in custody.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Lue Xiong.  District Attorney Peter Rindal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This is the date and time set for a status conference. There is not an agreement at this time. Defense is requesting a speedy jury trial to be set at this time. Parties think this will be a 3 day trial. Parties to contact JA for scheduling.

Conditions: 
No contact with his 87 year old father or the residence.
No contact with his mother, Y.X.
No use or possession of any weapons, including knives.
Take all prescribed medications as prescribed.

(Case called at 4:00 PM)
Defendant Lue Xiong in court, in custody with Attorney Roger Hillestad.  District Attorney Peter Rindal in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State filed motion to increase the cash bond.  Defense objects.  State outlines argument for the increase in cash bond- charges have been amended to more serious offenses and Defendant has made concerning phone calls from the jail.  Defense argues against any modification noting that the facts of the case have not changed and that the case was charged correctly initially.  Court orders that the bond is increased to a $25,000 cash bond and adds a condition of "No use or possession of weapons, including knives" and "Take all prescribed medications as prescribed".
Motion hearing on September 6, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
State's Motion to Increase Bond
Status conference on October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

(9:16 AM case called.) Defendant Lue Xiong in court, in custody. Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Lue Xiong. Prosecuting Attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court notes victim J.X. is present via Zoom telephonically.
Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas, which the Court receives. 
Attorney Hillestad advises is working on obtaining all discovery and requests a status conference be scheduled.
Court orders 20 days for filing of motions which may be extended for good cause.
State advises will more than likely be filing a motion regarding bond modification.
Status Conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 1:30 pm (1/2 hour).
Order Approving request for statutory victim, J.X., to attend future proceedings by Zoom.
Dated 08/22/2022, Letter from Victim Witness Specialist Olivia Winters to Court requesting Zoom attendance for statutory victim.
Adding Count 1- Attempt First Degree Intentional Homicide with enhancers

Conditions:
No contact with his 87 year old father or the residence.
No contact with his mother, Y.X.

(4:30 PM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Lue Xiong in court, in custody. Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Lue Xiong. 
State calls Officer Jimmy Vang of the Eau Claire Police Department, who is sworn and testifies.
Attorney Hillestad conducts cross-examination of Officer Vang. Witness excused.
State moves for bind over. Attorney Hillestad has no argument.
Court finds probable cause and binds the case over.
State requests bond modification to include no contact with Y.X. Attorney Hillestad has no objection.
Court approves the bond modification to include no contact with Y.X.
Attorney Hillestad to schedule an Arraignment with the Branch 2 Judicial Assistant.

Amending Count 1 to Physical Abuse of an Elder Person. 
Adding Repeater and Domestic Abuse enhancer to Count 2. 
Removing Count 3- Disorderly Conduct. 
Renumbering Count 4- Obstructing an Officer to Count 3 and adding Repeater enhancer.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: SPD Appointment - Attorney Roger Hillestad
Preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

(Case called at 11:27 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Lue Xiong appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Katherine Cook. ADA Monica Fallon appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of complaint and updates Defendant's address and phone number. State requests $1,000 cash bond. Defense requests signature bond. Court orders $1,000 cash bond with various conditions. 
Preliminary Hearing: 08/02/2022 at 2:30 PM.
